item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, March 13, 2025 at 11:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Huawei targeted in new European Parliament corruption probe (49 points | 19 comments)
2. Cursor told me I should learn coding instead of asking it to generate it (351 points | 212 comments)
3. Mark Klein, AT&T whistleblower who revealed NSA mass spying, has died (1115 points | 241 comments)
4. Amateur Telescope Making Main Page (3 points | discuss)
5. My teen years: The transputer operating system (137 points | 17 comments)
6. Game Boy Advance Architecture – A Practical Analysis (12 points | discuss)
7. Practical UX for startups surviving without a designer (240 points | 77 comments)
8. Gemini Robotics (761 points | 444 comments)
9. Dithering in Colour (28 points | 12 comments)
10. The DuckDB Local UI (725 points | 161 comments)
11. xlskubectl – a spreadsheet to control your Kubernetes cluster (112 points | 37 comments)
12. Show HN: Time Portal – Get dropped into history, guess where you landed (318 points | 149 comments)
13. Switching from Pyenv to Uv (281 points | 150 comments)
14. Open source software for modeling soft materials (11 points | discuss)
15. Iconography of the PuTTY tools (287 points | 75 comments)
16. Tell Mozilla: it's time to ditch Google (376 points | 387 comments)
17. Internet shutdowns at record high in Africa as access 'weaponised' (45 points | 9 comments)

23. The insecurity of telecom stacks in the wake of Salt Typhoon (284 points | 184 comments)
24. I use Cursor daily - here's how I avoid the garbage parts (213 points | 208 comments)
25. The cultural divide between mathematics and AI (217 points | 127 comments)
26. Reverse engineering OpenAI code execution to make it run C and JavaScript (236 points | 56 comments)
27. The Future Is Niri (354 points | 179 comments)
28. Apple has locked me in the same cage Microsoft's built for Windows 10 users (190 points | 241 comments)
29. I stopped everything and started writing C again (316 points | 317 comments)
30. My stupid noise journey (2023) (130 points | 145 comments)
